technical.name: Technical Workshop
technical.about: A hands-on session led by experts on emerging technologies like AI, Cloud, and DevOps. You'll get practical exposure and a certificate of participation.
rules: Individual registration only
Participants must bring their own laptops

technical.name: Prompt to Product
technical.about: An event where teams use AI to build a real-world product from an idea. The event ends with a 3-minute product pitch to judges, with the top 5 teams advancing to a Grand Finale.
rules: Team Size: Exactly 3 members
Participants must bring their own laptops
Any AI model or tool is permitted
A final report is required, including tools used, GitHub repo, and deployed link

technical.name: Competitive Programming
technical.about: Welcome to a competitive programming arena where your code is your currency. In this high-stakes survival event, participants must strategically manage their points to acquire new challenges and place wagers on their own solutions. It's a thrilling test of not just coding skill, but also of confidence, risk management, and nerve under pressure.
rulesAndGuidelines: All participants will begin with an equal, fixed number of starting points
A participant is eliminated if their point total drops to zero or below

Every code submission must be accompanied by a 'Confidence Wager'. A correct submission rewards you with the problem's value plus your wager. An incorrect submission results in the loss of your wagered points
The competition ends when only one participant remains, or when the 2-hour time limit expires. If multiple participants remain, the one with the highest point total wins

technical.name: Capture The Flag (CTF)
technical.about: A cybersecurity competition where you find hidden "flags" in systems. It's a hands-on challenge involving ethical hacking, cryptography, and network security.
rules: Team Size: 1–3 members
Bring your own laptop with tools pre-installed
The team that captures the most valid flags wins
Sharing flags is not allowed

technical.name: 24-Hour Hackathon
technical.about: The flagship 24-hour coding marathon to build a working prototype from an idea. Mentors will be available for guidance.
rules: Team Size: Up to 4 members
This is a 24-hour on-site event
Bring your own laptops and accessories
A final project report with GitHub repo and a demo is required

technical.name: CAED – Computer-Aided Engineering Drawing
technical.about: A design challenge focused on precision and creativity using CAD software. Participants will create 2D/3D models based on provided specifications.
rules: Individual participation only
Bring your own laptop with licensed or educational CAD software (e.g., AutoCAD, SolidWorks)
Evaluation is based on creativity, accuracy, and presentation

technical.name: Circuit Mania
technical.subtitle: The Debugging Challenge

about.description: A 3-hour gauntlet designed to find the best circuit debuggers. This competition tests both simulation and hands-on hardware debugging skills through two challenging phases.
highlights: Phase 1: Debug pre-bugged circuits in LTspice simulation software
Phase 2: Fix physically-faulty circuit kits using lab equipment
Top 15 teams from Phase 1 advance to the hardware challenge
Race against time and other finalists to demonstrate working circuits

rules: Team Size: Each team must consist of exactly three members.
Entry Fee: The entry fee is ₹150 per team.
Punctuality: Check-in ends at 2:15 PM. Teams arriving after 2:15 PM will be disqualified with no refund. This schedule is non-negotiable.

items.question: Equipment
items.answer: One PC will be provided to each team. Teams may not use personal laptops.

items.question: Submission
items.answer: All answers must be submitted via the official Google Form. Only one submission per team is allowed.

items.question: Cheating Policy
items.answer: The use of mobile phones, external websites, or any form of communication with other teams is strictly prohibited. Any team caught doing so will be immediately disqualified.

items.question: Qualification
items.answer: The Top 15 teams with the highest scores will advance. All ties will be broken by the earliest submission timestamp on the Google Form.

items.question: Equipment
items.answer: All necessary components and lab equipment (Oscilloscope, DMM, Power Supply, Breadboard) will be provided. Teams may not use any personal components or tools.

items.question: Winning Criteria
items.answer: The first three teams to raise their hand and successfully demonstrate the correctly functioning circuit to a judge will be declared the winners.

items.question: Judge's Decision
items.answer: The judge's decision on a circuit's functionality is final. Arguing with a judge will lead to disqualification.

items.question: Safety
items.answer: Any team found mishandling or intentionally damaging lab equipment will be disqualified and held liable.

technical.name: Ideathon

about.description: A two-round business pitch competition where innovation meets strategy. Participants present their business plans or prototypes to internal faculty first, with top teams advancing to pitch before external industry experts.
highlights: Round 1: Business Plan/Prototype Presentation before Internal Faculty Panel
Round 2: Final Pitch to External Experts from Industry & Academia
Present Business Model, Revenue Streams, Marketing Plans & Financial Viability
10-minute presentation followed by Q&A session with the jury panel

schedule.activity: Business Plan/Prototype Presentation - Internal Faculty Jury
Final Pitch to External Experts - Top teams only

rules: Open to all UG & PG students
Team size: Maximum 3 members per team
Ideas should focus on innovation, feasibility, and real-world impact
Shortlisted teams will present their business plan or prototype offline
Each team will get 10 minutes for presentation and discussion
The jury's decision will be final and binding

gaming.name: PUBG MOBILE (Battle Royale)
gaming.about: Enter the battleground and fight for survival in the classic Erangel map! Compete in intense matches where strategy, teamwork, and skill decide who becomes the last squad standing.
rules: Team Size: Maximum 4 players
Attendance: Minimum 3 players must be present physically; 1 can play online
Format: Battle Royale format only
Equipment: Players must use their own mobile devices

gaming.name: VALORANT
gaming.about: Assemble your squad of agents and dive into tactical 5v5 battles! Compete in thrilling matches that test coordination, reflexes, and strategy.
rules: Team Size: Maximum 5 players
Attendance: At least 3 players must be present physically; 2 may play online
Equipment: Teams must bring their own equipment (laptop/PC, keyboard, mouse, headset)

gaming.name: FIFA (EA FC 24 or Latest Version)
gaming.about: Step onto the virtual pitch and showcase your football finesse! Experience the thrill of one-on-one matches.
rules: Format: Solo competition (1v1)
Attendance: Physical attendance is compulsory
Controllers: Bring your own or use the limited ones available

gaming.name: Chess Tournament
gaming.about: A battle of wits following FIDE (World Chess Federation) Rules.
gaming.tournamentFormat: Matches will follow FIDE (World Chess Federation) Rules. The format will be Knockout or Swiss, depending on the number of participants
gaming.timeControl: Rapid: 5 minutes + 3 seconds increment. The final time control will be announced before each round
basicRules: Two illegal moves result in the loss of the game
No external help or devices are allowed
Arriving more than 5 minutes late will result in forfeiture
The arbiter's or organizer's decision is final

nonTechnical.name: TREASURE HUNT
nonTechnical.about: Unleash your inner detective and race against time! Follow a trail of hidden clues, solve riddles, and collaborate with your team to uncover the ultimate treasure.
rules: Team Size: 4 members (from the same institution)
Entry Limit: Maximum of 10 teams per institution are allowed
Restrictions: Use of mobile phones or internet is strictly prohibited unless permitted

nonTechnical.name: Bridge Building
nonTechnical.about: A design challenge focused on precision and creativity. Participants will construct a model bridge from provided materials based on specifications, which will then be tested for its load-bearing capacity.
rules: Team Size: 2-4 members
All materials will be provided on-site. Using external materials is prohibited
Evaluation is based on creativity, design efficiency, and the weight the bridge can withstand
